page.title: 05PUBLIC TRANSPORT SEAHOUSES
page.content: The only public transport running directly into Seahouses is provided by the United Bus Company. Most buses come from Alnwick 16 miles away which lies on the A.1 Trunk Road where they connect with main services to Newcastle and the South and Berwick and Edinburgh to the North. This service is heavily subsidised and is only well used in the summer, mainly by visitors, however, it is essential as the only means of transport for many residents. Following railway closures the nearest railway station is at Chathill (5 Miles) on the main London - Edinburgh line. There are only two trains in each direction daily. For those without cars a useful link is provided by the relatively new Post Bus Service.
